Description.Text: A boutique style, privately run hotel, situated in an historic villa built in 1840 for a wealthy cloth manufacturer. The villa then became the home of the first Mayor of Eccles and the building retains many of its original splendid features. The Ascott Hotel is located within a beautifully leafy superb of Manchester, within walking distance of a variety of restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets. The Hotel is also just 10 minutes (5 miles) from Manchester City Centre and is close to the Metro and Train links to give quick and easy access to the City whilst also being close to the M602 and offering complimentary on site car parking. The Hotel has a large period style guest lounge whilst each bedroom has been individually designed with all modern facilities. The Hotel also boasts a freshly prepared a la carte breakfast including continental options, full English, Smoked Salmon and Kippers. All served with freshly ground coffee or your choice from the selection of teas. PLEASE NOTE: Reception closes at 10pm every night and all guests must have checked in before this time to ensure they have access to the Hotel as they require. We do not accept arrivals after 10pm. On Fridays, Sundays and UK Bank Holidays the Hotel's reception desk is closed between 1pm and 5pm. Arrivals will not be accepted between these times. Breakfast is served between 8.30am and 9.30am on these days. We look forward to welcoming you to Manchester and The Ascott.

The Hotel is located 5 miles from the City Centre with free onsite parking and easy access to transport links. The ideal base for visiting MEN Arena, The Lowry Centre, Chill Factor E (Indoor Snowdome), Museum of Science and Industry, Trafford Park, Trafford Centre, Manchester Utd - Old Trafford, Manchester City - Eastlands, Lancashire County Cricket Club, Salford Quays, Universities, Apollo, Eccles Fit City, The Printworks, Urbis, Smiths Restaurant (highly recommended), Bridgewater Concert Hall, MICC (G-MEX), International Convention Centre, the Art Gallery, the Opera House and Halle Orchestra. PLEASE NOTE: Reception closes at 10pm every night and all guests must have checked in before this time to ensure they have access to the Hotel as they require. We do not accept arrivals after 10pm. On Fridays, Sundays and UK Bank Holidays the Hotel's reception desk is closed between 1pm and 5pm. Arrivals will not be accepted between these times.

Deluxe Double Room - With one double bed. Our deluxe bedrooms are larger than our standard rooms with high quality decorative features. The rooms are en-suite with bath and shower, individually styled and furnished to a very high standard. Offering free WiFI, tea and coffee making facilities and colour television with freeview. PLEASE NOTE: All rooms are non smoking. PLEASE NOTE: Reception closes at 10pm every night and all guests must have checked in before this time to ensure they have access to the Hotel as they require. We do not accept arrivals after 10pm. On Fridays, Sundays and UK Bank Holidays the Hotel's reception desk is closed between 1pm and 5pm. Arrivals will not be accepted between these times. Breakfast is served between 8.30am and 9.30am on these days.
